solution.text:
Initial Principal Amount(P) = Rs. _{{50000*j}}_
Rate of interest(R) = 10 %
Time period = _{k}_ + \(\frac12\) years
Calculating A for _{k}_ years, We get by compound interest formula, \( A = P \times ((1+(R/100))^T) \)
Hence , A for _{k}_ years = \( _{{50000*j}}_ \times ((1+ 0.1)^_{k}_) \)= Rs. _{{50000*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k)}}_
Now calculating SI for the next \(\frac12\) year we get SI = \( (P \times R \times T)/100 \) = (_{{50000*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k)}}_ x 10 x \(\frac12\))/100= Rs. _{{2500*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k)}}_
Therefore, Total Amount = New principal + SI = _{{50000*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k)}}_ + _{{2500*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k)}}_ = Rs. _{{50000*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k) + (2500*j*((Decimal('1.1'))**k))}}_

content.text: Arjun got a grant of Rs. _{{50000*j}}_ which he smartly put in a bank at a compound interest rate of 10% per annum. What would be his final amount after _{k}_ and a \( \frac12 \) years ?
